page.title: 18ECHO
page.content: { THE MANSFIELD CASSETTE MAGAZINE {ASSOCIATION}PROVIDE THE BLIND POPULATION OF MANSFIELD WITH A MONTHLY MAGAZINE RECORDED ON CASSETTE,CALLED {'THE MANSFIELD ECHO' IT IS PRODUCED BY A TEAM OF VOLUNTEERS WHO RESEARCH THE MATERIAL AND INFORMATION,COMPILE AND EDIT IT,OPERATE THE RECORDING EQUIPMENT AND READ THE ITEMS ONTO THE TAPE.THESE INCLUDE LOCAL NEWS,OBITUARIES,ROAD WORKS AND FOOT PATHS HAZARDS,QUIZZES, A POSTBAG AND FEATURE ITEMS OF LOCAL INTEREST. THE MAGAZINE IS RECORDED AND ABOUT 250 COPIES OF THE TAPE ARE MADE.THEY ARE SENT TO THE BLIND PEOPLE BY ROYAL MAIL, FREE OF CHARGE. THE BLIND OWNER RETURNS THE PREVIOUS MONTHS CASSETTES, FOR THE RECORDING OF NEXT MONTHS.ALL EXPENSES ARE MET BY VOLUNTARY SUBSCIPTIONS AND CHARITIES.
